Class WordReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordReader
  • public class WordReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains code to read line from a file and to break those lines up into individual words.
    Version:
    9 April 2020
    Author:
    Alyce Brady, Sophie Sjogren

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      WordReader​(java.lang.String filename)
      Constructs an object that can read lines from a file, or can report on word frequencies for every word in the file.

      Returns how many times the given word occurs in this book (ignoring capitalization).

      Reads the next non-empty line from the file provided to the constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WordReader

        public WordReader​(java.lang.String filename)
        Constructs an object that can read lines from a file, or can report on word frequencies for every word in the file. It uses the following regular expression to parse words: ("\\P{L}+") (Thanks to Pierre C on Stack Overflow.)
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to open for reading

    • Method Detail

      • getNextLine

        public java.lang.String getNextLine()
        Reads the next non-empty line from the file provided to the constructor. Precondition: the constructor must have successfully opened the file for reading
        Returns:
        String contains the contents of the line that was just read

      • breakIntoWords

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> breakIntoWords​(java.lang.String lineOfText)
        Takes a line of text containing multiple words and returns an ArrayList of the individual words that were in the line. It uses the following regular expression to parse words: ("\\P{L}+") (Thanks to Pierre C on Stack Overflow.) Note that this method considers hyphens, apostrophes, and other punctuation to be word separators, so "don't" or "fast-forward" would each break into two words.
        Parameters:
        lineOfText - a string containing 1 or more words
        Returns:
        a list of the words that were in the string

      • getFullWordList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFullWordList()
        Gets a list of all the distinct words in this book (each word occurs only once in the list). Words have all been converted to lower case to avoid duplication based on capitalization; for example, "They" and "they" will both appear as "they" in the word list. This method can called anytime after this object is constructed; it does not depend on calls to the getNextLine method.
        Returns:
        the list of words in the book

      • getCountFor

        public int getCountFor​(java.lang.String word)
        Returns how many times the given word occurs in this book (ignoring capitalization). For example, if this method is called with either "They" or "they" as a parameter, it will return how many times the word occurs with any capitalization (including "THEY"). This method can called anytime after this object is constructed; it does not depend on calls to the getNextLine method.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to count
        Returns:
        the number of times word occurs in this book
